definition: thin/to lose weight/(of clothing) tight/(of meat) lean/(of land) unproductive

sentences.english: For example, one compares flat and little space, unfavorable put gangling thing.
sentences.chinese: 例如，一個比較扁而小的空間，就不宜放瘦長之物。

sentences.english: The angel told the evangelist's evangel to a gang of fanged gangling gangsters.
sentences.chinese: 天使把福音傳道者的佳音傳給一夥有毒牙的瘦長匪徒。

sentences.english: He was swinging the two long and skinny legs and treading the muddy water with a clattering sound.
sentences.chinese: 他撩開兩條瘦長的腿，撲踏撲踏地踩着泥水走着。

sentences.english: They may be nearly circular or so elongated that they take on a cigarlike appearance.
sentences.chinese: 它們可能接近圓形或者接近雪茄一樣的瘦長形。

sentences.english: He had a long, thin body and the scholar's stoop.
sentences.chinese: 他身材瘦長並且象學者一樣彎腰駝背。

sentences.english: Those who interpose is young people, lanky stature, body cowboy clothes.
sentences.chinese: 插話進來的是一個年輕人，瘦長身材，一身牛仔衣。
他身材瘦長而結識，動作敏捷，身體強壯。

definition: perfectly round/(fig.) accommodating/considerate/smooth (way of doing things)
Guangdong embroidery, one of the four major traditional styles of Chinese embroidery (the other three being 蘇繡|苏绣[Su1 xiu4], 湘繡|湘绣[Xiang1 xiu4] and 蜀繡|蜀绣[Shu3 xiu4])
to apply makeup conspicuously (idiom)/dressed to the nines and wearing makeup
see 櫻桃小嘴|樱桃小嘴[ying1 tao2 xiao3 zui3]
